data.title: Emily Schaal
data.text:
Office: Math Tower, 3-106

Email: emily.schaal[at]stonybrook.edu

I'm a fifth year graduate student at Stony Brook University studying problems related to the stability of the Positive Mass Theorem and the Penrose Inequality. My advisor is Marcus Khuri.

I grew up just outside of Washington, DC and studied mathematics and economics during my undergraduate degree at the College of William and Mary. I wrote my undergraduate thesis on a numerical analysis solution to problem in differential equations. At Stony Brook, I initially studied complex geometry and H&oumlrmander-type theorems before switching to Riemannian geometry and General Relativity.
